channel.title: Lecture Notes on MIT OpenCourseWare
channel.description: Recent content in Lecture Notes on MIT OpenCourseWare

item.title: lec1.pdf
item.description: Lecture notes with an introduction to machine learning and discussion of linear classification and the perceptron update rule.

item.title: lec10.pdf
item.description: Lecture notes on model selection criteria, structural risk minimization, example derivation, Bayesian score, and Bayesian Information Criterion (BIC).

item.title: lec11.pdf
item.description: Lecture notes on model selection criteria, minimum description length (MDL), and feature (subset) selection.

item.title: lec12.pdf
item.description: Lecture notes on model selection criteria, feature subset selection, information criterion, conditional log-likelihood and description length, regularization, combination of classifiers, and boosting.

item.title: lec13.pdf
item.description: This resource explains about boosting, margin, gradient descent, complexity of classifiers, and generalization.

item.title: lec14.pdf
item.description: Lecture notes on margin and generalization, linear classifiers, ensembles, and mixture models.

item.title: lec15.pdf
item.description: Lecture notes on different types of mixture models, estimating mixtures, and the EM algorithm.

item.title: lec16.pdf
item.description: Lecture notes on mixture of Gaussians, the EM algorithm, additional mixture topics, regularization, stage-wise mixtures, conditional mixtures, and mixture models and clustering.

item.title: lec17.pdf
item.description: Lecture notes on mixture models and clustering, k-means, and distance and clustering.

item.title: lec18.pdf
item.description: Lecture notes on spectral clustering, random walks, and Markov chains.

item.title: lec19.pdf
item.description: Lecture notes on Markov chains and hidden Markov models.

item.title: lec2.pdf
item.description: Lecture notes on perceptron, convergence, and generalization.

item.title: lec20.pdf
item.description: Lecture notes on hidden Markov models.

item.title: lec21.pdf
item.description: Lecture notes on Bayesian networks.

item.title: lec22.pdf
item.description: Lecture notes on learning Bayesian networks, maximum likelihood, BIC, and marginal likelihood.

item.title: lec23.pdf
item.description: Lecture notes on Markov random fields and probabilistic inference.

item.title: lec3.pdf
item.description: Lecture notes on the support vector machine.

item.title: lec4.pdf
item.description: Lecture notes on the support vector machine, classification errors, regularization, logistic regression.

item.title: lec5.pdf
item.description: Lecture notes on linear regression, estimator bias and variance, and active learning.

item.title: lec6.pdf
item.description: Lecture notes on active learning, non-linear predictions, and kernals.

item.title: lec7.pdf
item.description: Lecture notes on the kernel form of linear regression, kernels, examples, construction, and properties.

item.title: lec8.pdf
item.description: Lecture notes on support vector machine (SVM), kernels, and kernel optimization.

item.title: lec9.pdf
item.description: Lecture notes on kernel optimization and model selection.

item.title: Lecture Notes
item.description:
LECÂ # TOPICS
1 Introduction, linear classification, perceptron update rule (PDF)
2 Perceptron convergence, generalization (PDF)
3 Maximum margin classification (PDF)
4 Classification errors, regularization, logistic regression (PDF)
5 Linear regression, estimator bias and variance, active learning (PDF)
6 Active learning (cont.), non-linear predictions, kernals (PDF)
7 Kernal regression, kernels (PDF)
8 Support vector machine (SVM) and kernels, kernel optimization (PDF)
